revised_title: Diphydontosaurus avonis: A New Sphenodontid Reptile and Insights into the Evolution of Sphenodon
tldr: The author describes the head skeleton of the Rhaetian sphenodontid reptile Diphydontosaurus avonis, a new species found in limestone deposits in the Tytherington quarry near Bristol. The fossils provide insights into the evolution of the 'living fossil' Sphenodon, challenging the idea that it is more archaic than previously thought. The study highlights the unique features of Diphydontosaurus, such as its pleurodont and acrodont teeth, and its position within the Sphenodontidae family.
